item.title: Moon Mystery coming to PS5, Xbox Series on September 18
item.content:encoded:
• PS5
  • Xbox Series

Currently available for PC.

Publisher indie.io and developer Cosmoscouts will release interstellar first-person shooter adventure game Moon Mystery for PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series on September 18 for $19.99, the companies announced.

Moon Mystery first launched for PC via Steam on October 28, 2024.

Here is an overview of the game, via indie.io:

The Moon. Our closest celestial neighbor. A place full of mystery and strange things. That’s right, there’s more than just rocks and impossible challenges out there. A lone astronaut is about to learn that first hand, when he loses contact with Earth and begins an interstellar odyssey across the universe

Moon Mystery is a first-person shooter adventure full of puzzles, action, set on strange new worlds. The gray rocks of the Moon are just the first step on a great journey. Fill up your oxygen tanks, top up your magazines, and get ready for a long trip. You won’t be seeing Earth for a while.

Humanity’s return to the Moon was no easy feat, requiring state-of-the-art technologies and Artificial Intelligence. Piece together what happened to the previous mission on the Silver Globe alongside the sole survivor, the AI computer. Our first permanent lunar base being the origin point for where everything went wrong. What happened? What do you need to prepare yourself against? Just why did we go to the Moon in the first place?

The Moon is one of the most hostile environments known to man. Put wits and platforming skills to the test while traversing treacherous landscapes and vast abandoned bases. Pilot multiple vehicles such as spaceships, radio-controlled cars, lunar rovers, and even a submarine to get through alien worlds and solve the many puzzles that await.

While outsmarting puzzles and platforming through the environment is one thing… Dealing with malfunctioning robots stalking the corridors alongside other, more terrifying and mysterious foes, is another. Keep that gun loaded alongside oxygen bottles, you’ll need it.

item.title: PC Gaming Show Tokyo Direct set for September 28
item.content:encoded:
Exclusive trailers, news, interviews, and announcements from Tokyo Game Show 2025.

PC Gamer will host PC Gaming Show Tokyo Direct, a new dedicated show as part of Tokyo Gmae Show 2025, on September 28 at 9:00 a.m. PT / 12:00 p.m. ET, the outlet announced. You will be able to watch it on YouTube, Twitch, Twitter, Facebook, and Steam.

PC Gaming Show Tokyo Direct, hosted by Elle Osili Wood and PC Gamer’s Midas, will spotlight upcoming games on PC with publishers such as Devolver Digital, Nightdive Studios, and SEGA confirmed to appear. Viewers can expect exclusive trailers, news from the Tokyo Game Show 2025 show floor, developer interviews, and exclusive announcements.

Stay tuned.

item.title: Sushi Ben for PC launches September 18 with flatscreen support, new content
item.content:encoded:
• PC

Playable with or without a virtual reality headset.

Big Brane Studios will release anime-style interactive adventure game Sushi Ben for PC via Steam on September 18 with support for both flatscreen and virtual reality headset play, as well as over four hours of new content and English voice acting, the developer announced.

Sushi Ben first launched for Quest on October 19, 2023, followed by VIVE on December 13, 023, and PlayStation VR2 on May 28, 2024. Big Brane Studios also plans to release the new content for existing versions of the game, including flatscreen support for PlayStation 5, and will make a proper announcement at a later date.

Here is an overview of the PC release, via Big Brane Studios:

About

Welcome to Kotobuki town, a quaint community currently being gobbled up acre by acre by dastardly big-city landsharks. It’s also your new home. Do you have what it takes to bring the locals together and save their beloved sushi bar?

Inspired by slice-of-life anime, Sushi Ben is a sweet, funny and bombastic narrative adventure about finding your feet in a new town (and sticking it to landlords while you’re at it). Featuring a gorgeous seaside setting, immersive 3D manga panels, a fully voiced cast of colourful characters, and plenty of minigames—fishing, archery, dog walking, and even ghost hunting…!?

With narrative talents of Hato Moa (Hatoful Boyfriend) and voice acting by Laura Post (Little Witch Academia) Ryan Colt Levy (Chainsaw Man), AJ Beckles (Dandadan), and many more!

Key Features

  • An interactive anime story!
  • Pop out manga panels bring the tale to life!
  • Colorful cast of small town characters!
  • Wholesome and over-the-top!
  • Four hours of mini-games—fishing, archery, ghost hunting and more!
  • Available in flatscreen and virtual reality!
  • Full voice acting from a stacked 30-plus person cast!
  • Narrative by the creator of Hatoful Boyfriend!
